page.title: 15St. Etheldreda's church (2)
page.content: The church has three bells which it is possible for one person to chime using both hands and one foot. All the windows except one are less than 100 years old. A much older but very small one was found which is about 750 years old and it shows St.Etheldreda which is why the church has been rededicated. In 1979 a restoration appeal was started and well over{Â£20000}has been raised since then and a great deal of work completed. In the summer of 1984 work was started on the nave roof and this has now been finished and looks very smart. A lot more work is planned. The vicar of White Notley is also vicar of the parishes of Faulkbourne and Cressing. He has written several books about the hobby of collecting match box labels.
